product_summary: Imaginary Programming is a TypeScript-based tool that allows developers to use OpenAI's GPT engine as a runtime to accomplish tasks that were previously impossible in code. By defining a function prototype with a good comment, Imaginary Programming uses GPT to take care of the implementation. This makes it easy to add AI capabilities to existing projects and tackle new problems that require human-like intelligence around text.
product_pros: Easy to use: Developers can add AI capabilities to their projects without having to spend months training an AI model.
Powerful: GPT is a powerful AI engine that can generate text, classify data, and extract structured data from unstructured language.
Flexible: Imaginary Programming can be used for a wide range of tasks, from generating titles and summaries to classifying customer emails and extracting data from text.
Extensible: Imaginary Programming is TypeScript-based, so it can be easily integrated with existing JavaScript and TypeScript projects.
Affordable: Imaginary Programming is free to use.
product_cons: Limited functionality: Imaginary Programming is still in development and does not support all of the features of a traditional programming language.
Can be unpredictable: GPT is a large language model and its output can sometimes be unpredictable or nonsensical.
Requires an internet connection: Imaginary Programming requires an internet connection to access the GPT engine.
Can be slow: GPT can be slow to generate output, especially for complex tasks.
May be biased: GPT is trained on a massive dataset of text and may contain biases that can be reflected in its output.

product_usecases.case: Generate useful titles and text for your user
product_usecases.details: Any time you need to generate a useful title, summary, or text for your user. For example: "What's a good name for this user's playlist?"
Use Imaginary Programming to classify whether text has a particular semantic intent or emotion to it. For example: "How angry is this customer email?"

product_usecases.case: Parse: Extract structured data out of messy, unstructured language
product_usecases.details: Tell an imaginary function what kind of data you're looking for, and the function will find the structure inside the mess. For example: "What are the proper names in this email text?"
Provide Imaginary Programming with a long document or article, and it will generate a concise summary that captures the main points.
Imaginary Programming can translate text between over 100 languages, making it easy to communicate with people from all over the world.

product_toolfor.details: Imaginary Programming is a great tool for frontend developers who want to add AI capabilities to their projects without having to learn a new programming language.
Imaginary Programming can be used by data scientists to extract insights from unstructured data, such as customer reviews or social media posts.
Imaginary Programming can be used by content creators to generate ideas for new content, write headlines, and optimize their content for search engines.
Imaginary Programming is a great tool for students who want to learn about AI and machine learning without having to write code.

product_toolfor.target: Anyone who wants to use AI to solve problems
product_toolfor.details: Imaginary Programming is a powerful tool that can be used by anyone to solve problems that require human-like intelligence around text.

product_pricing: Imaginary Programming is free to use.
